skills.name: Identify the Greatest Common Factor of two numbers (US)

explanations.A: The factors of 9 are 1, 3 and 9. The factors of 15 are 1, 3, 5 and 15. Therefore, the greatest common factor of 9 and 15 is 3!
explanations.B: This would be a factor of 15 but not a factor of 9... List the factors of both numbers and see what the greatest value in both lists is!
explanations.C: The lowest number is not always the greatest common factor... List the factors of both numbers and see what the greatest value in both lists is!
explanations.D: You have accidentally calculated the lowest common multiple... The question is asking for the greatest common factor!

explanations.A: You have accidentally calculated the lowest common multiple... The question is asking for the greatest common factor!
explanations.B: The lowest number is not always the greatest common factor... List the factors of both numbers and see what the greatest value in both lists is!
explanations.C: This would be a factor of 20 but not a factor of 12... List the factors of both numbers and see what the greatest value in both lists is!
explanations.D: The factors of 12 are 1, 2, 3, 4, 6 and 12. The factors of 20 are 1, 2, 4, 5, 10 and 20. Therefore, the greatest common factor of 12 and 20 is 4!

explanations.A: This is a common factor but it's not the greatest common factor! List the factors of both numbers and see what the greatest value in both lists is...
explanations.B: This is a common factor but it's not the greatest common factor! List the factors of both numbers and see what the greatest value in both lists is...
explanations.C: The factors of 8 are 1, 2, 4 and 8. The factors of 32 are 1, 2, 4, 8, 16 and 32. Therefore, the greatest common factor of 8 and 32 is 8!
explanations.D: This would be a factor of 32 but not a factor of 8... List the factors of both numbers and see what the greatest value in both lists is!

explanations.A: The factors of 18 are 1, 2, 3, 6, 9 and 18. The factors of 54 are 1, 2, 3, 6, 9, 18, 27 and 54. Therefore, the greatest common factor of 18 and 54 is 18!
explanations.B: This would be a factor of 54 but not a factor of 18... List the factors of both numbers and see what the greatest value in both lists is!
explanations.C: This is a common factor but it's not the greatest common factor! List the factors of both numbers and see what the greatest value in both lists is...
explanations.D: This is a common factor but it's not the greatest common factor! List the factors of both numbers and see what the greatest value in both lists is...

explanations.A: This is a common factor but it's not the greatest common factor! List the factors of both numbers and see what the greatest value in both lists is...
explanations.B: The factors of 40 are 1, 2, 4, 5, 8, 10, 20 and 40. The factors of 60 are 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 10, 12, 15, 20, 30 and 60. Therefore, the greatest common factor of 40 and 60 is 20!
explanations.C: The lowest number is not always the greatest common factor... List the factors of both numbers and see what the greatest value in both lists is!
explanations.D: 60 is greater than 40 so it is not a factor. To find the greatest common factor, list the factors of both numbers and see what the greatest value in both lists is!

explanations.A: 90 is greater than 60 so it is not a factor. To find the greatest common factor, list the factors of both numbers and see what the greatest value in both lists is!
explanations.B: The lowest number is not always the greatest common factor... List the factors of both numbers and see what the greatest value in both lists is!
explanations.C: The factors of 60 are 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 10, 12, 15, 20, 30 and 60. The factors of 90 are 1, 2, 3, 5, 6, 9, 10, 15, 18, 30, 45 and 90. Therefore, the greatest common factor of 60 and 90 is 30!
explanations.D: This is a common factor but it's not the greatest common factor! List the factors of both numbers and see what the greatest value in both lists is...

explanations.A: 0 is only a factor of 0! To find the greatest common factor of 11 and 35, list the factors of both numbers and see what the greatest value in both lists is...
explanations.B: The factors of 11 are 1 and 11, as it is a prime number. The factors of 35 are 1, 5, 7 and 35. Therefore the greatest common factor of 11 and 35 is 1!
explanations.C: This would be a factor of 35 but not a factor of 11... List the factors of both numbers and see what the greatest value in both lists is!
explanations.D: They do have a greatest common factor... The universal factor! List the factors of both numbers and see what the greatest value in both lists is...

explanations.A: This would be a factor of 28 but not a factor of 17... List the factors of both numbers and see what the greatest value in both lists is!
explanations.B: 0 is only a factor of 0! To find the greatest common factor of 17 and 28, list the factors of both numbers and see what the greatest value in both lists is...
explanations.C: The factors of 17 are 1 and 17, as it is a prime number. The factors of 28 are 1, 2, 4, 7, 14 and 28. Therefore the greatest common factor of 17 and 28 is 1!
explanations.D: They do have a greatest common factor... The universal factor! List the factors of both numbers and see what the greatest value in both lists is...

explanations.A: This is a common factor but it's not the greatest common factor! List the factors of all three numbers and see what the greatest value in all their lists is...
explanations.B: The factors of 16 are 1, 2, 4, 8 and 16. The factors of 28 are 1, 2, 4, 7, 14 and 28. The factors of 88 are 1, 2, 4, 8, 11, 22, 44 and 88. Therefore, the greatest common factor of 16, 28 and 88 is 4!
explanations.C: This is the greatest common factor of 16 and 88 but is not a factor of 28. You need to find the greatest common factor of all three numbers!
explanations.D: The lowest number is not always the greatest common factor... List the factors of all three numbers and see what the greatest value in all their lists is!

explanations.A: This is the greatest common factor of 20 and 30 but is not a factor of 45. You need to find the greatest common factor of all three numbers!
explanations.B: The factors of 20 are 1, 2, 4, 5, 10 and 20. The factors of 30 are 1, 2, 3, 5, 6, 10, 15 and 30. The factors of 45 are 1, 3, 5, 9, 15 and 45. Therefore, the greatest common factor of 20, 30 and 45 is 5!
explanations.C: This is the greatest common factor of 30 and 45 but is not a factor of 20. You need to find the greatest common factor of all three numbers!
explanations.D: This is a common factor but it's not the greatest common factor! List the factors of all three numbers and see what the greatest value in all their lists is...
